meanings.definition: To buy back or repurchase goods previously sold.
meanings.sent1: She regrated the antique vase from the pawn shop.
meanings.sent2: The store regrated the defective products from unhappy customers.
meanings.sent3: John regrated his old bicycle just to relive his childhood memories.
meanings.sent4: The company decided to regrate their original logo after a failed rebranding attempt.
meanings.sent5: The idea of regrating the lost time with loved ones brought tears to her eyes.

meanings.definition: To sell goods again at a higher price.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky vendor regrated the stolen goods to unsuspecting buyers.
meanings.sent2: After fixing the broken items, she regrated them for a profit.
meanings.sent3: The farmer regrated his produce with a mischievous grin, knowing they were in high demand.
meanings.sent4: The art dealer decided to regrate the famous painting after its value skyrocketed.
meanings.sent5: She cleverly regrated the limited edition sneakers to collectors for a hefty sum.

meanings.sent1: The shop owner regrated the finest tobacco for his regular customers.
meanings.sent2: He regrated the aromatic tobacco leaves to cigar enthusiasts.
meanings.sent3: The old man regrated the tobacco with a secret blend that everyone loved.
meanings.sent4: The tobacco connoisseur decided to regrate a rare blend for a special occasion.
meanings.sent5: The sweet aroma of regrated tobacco filled the room, delighting all who entered.
